fields.name: Assault on the Clone Master
fields.description: While you are traveling in the far-away land of Knieriem, a war breaks out with the feared clone army of the infamous Clone Master. Go with some rebel commandos to attack the Clone Master's headquarters and destroy his cloning machines to earn your way home. Inspired by the Classic Eamon adventure by Donald Brown.
fields.intro_text:
You were traveling in the far-away land of Knieriem, a land with technology far beyond your own. You marveled at the towering cities and majestic arches and goggled at the wondrous metal vehicles and flying machines powered by the most exquisite clockwork.

But, all was not well in Knieriem. A day before you were to leave for home on a massive, steam-powered ship, word came that the harbor was being blockaded by the dreaded fire fleets of the infamous Clone Master!

The Clone Master was known all over Knieriem and the surrounding kingdoms, feared for his vast armies made up of human clones!

You managed to get in touch with a group of rebels, who were recruiting seasoned adventurers for a dangerous mission. They promise you safe passage home if you join their commando raid directly into the heart of the Clone Master's headquarters and secret research facility, in the mountains on the border of Knieriem.

You travel for two days in a big, hulking steam locomotive. Then for another day you soar high above the mountains in a monstrous flying machine. You arrive at a camp where a rebel army has gathered, overlooking the Clone Master's headquarters in the valley below.

You are summoned to the command tent, where you meet the commando leader, Nasreen of Northampton. She tells you, "Our mission is to kill the Clone Master and destroy the cloning machinery. Another of our commanders, Natty of Nickelton, is already inside the fortress. We believe the Clone Master has taken him prisoner. We should rescue him if we can. Are you ready, soldier?"

fields.name: In the command tent
fields.description:
You are in the command tent of the rebel army. Rebel commanders are gathered around a large table showing a map of the area. Through a door to the south is the main army camp.

The map shows the mountains, the bay to the south, and the parade grounds outside the main gate of the Clone Master's fortress. The fortress itself appears as a series of large blocks showing the position of the buildings. The rebels do not seem to have much intelligence on what is inside.

fields.name: At the rebel camp
fields.description: You are in the rebel army camp in the mountains. Hundreds of rebel troops are here, donning their bizarre metal and leather armor and preparing for war. Two shiny, bulbous metal airships are tethered to the ground, seeming to hang in the air without wings. Soldiers are busy loading round, metal bombs into them.

fields.name: On the road
fields.description: You are on the road leading down out of the mountains. To the south, in the valley by the bay, you see the black walls and towers of the Clone Master's headquarters. A tall spire rises from the largest building, holding an immense sphere of turquoise glass. Your companions tell you that the spire is used for collecting lightning to power the cloning equipment, or so they think. The road leads south toward the fortress and north back to the rebel camp.

fields.name: The parade grounds
fields.description: You are on the Clone Master's parade grounds. It is a large, open field just north of the main gates. To the north is a road leading up to the rebel camp in the mountains. To the east is the bay, where several of the Clone Master's brass fire ships are docked. East and west are roads leading around the side of the fortress.

fields.name: At the northwest corner
fields.description: You are outside the fortress, at the northwest corner, between the mountain range and the fortress wall. A road follows the walls, leading south and east.

fields.name: Outside the west wall
fields.description: You are outside the west wall of the fortress. To the west is the mountains, too steep to climb. To the east and south are high fortress walls. A road leads north toward the main entrance.

fields.name: At the northeast corner
fields.description: You are at the northeast corner of the fortress, near the bay. A road follows the fortress wall to the west and south.

fields.name: Outside the east wall
fields.description: You are outside the east wall of the fortress. The bay is to the east and south (too deep to swim). The fortress wall is to the west and a road leads north.

fields.name: The main gate
fields.description: You are inside the main gate of the Clone Master's fortress. To the north, through the gate, is the parade grounds and the road to the mountains. To the south is a large courtyard. East is a stone building which appears to be a guard station. West is another stone building, with weapons hanging in the windows.

fields.name: The central courtyard
fields.description: You are in a large courtyard. The courtyard continues east, west, and south. The road to the main entrance is north.

fields.name: The west end of the courtyard
fields.description: You are at the west end of the large courtyard near the main entrance of the fortress. The courtyard continues to the east. To the south is a large building that looks like a barracks.

fields.name: The armory
fields.description: You are in the armory. Most of the weapons have been taken by the soldiers. A door leads east, back to the courtyard.

fields.name: The barracks
fields.description: You are in a large building that serves as a barracks for the clone army. The building is empty of soldiers because everyone is outside, fighting. You don't even see any wounded soldiers. There are bunk rooms to the west and south, and a door leads north to the courtyard. A sign on the wall says "Soldiers who die in duty will return."

fields.name: The west bunk room
fields.description: You are in a bunk room in the barracks. There are dozens of bunks here, all looking identical. The only exit is east.

fields.name: The south bunk room
fields.description: You are in a bunk room in the barracks. There are dozens of bunks here, all looking identical. The only exit is north.

fields.name: The east courtyard
fields.description:
You are at the east end of the large courtyard inside the main gate of the fortress. The courtyard continues west. To the south is a drab, stone building that looks like a servants' quarters.

You see servants carrying the bodies of dead clone soldiers through the courtyard into the building. Your companions tell you that they think the clone master can re-animate the soldiers with his cloning machines.

fields.name: The guard station
fields.description: You are in a guard station just inside the fortress wall. A stairway goes up to the fortress wall above, and a door leads west into the courtyard. Most of the guards are busy manning the fortress walls. There are racks on the walls for weapons and armor, but they are mostly empty. An odd-looking helmet near the west door catches your eye. A desk sits along one wall, with some papers on top.

fields.name: On the wall
fields.description: You are atop the outer wall of the fortress, looking north toward the battlefield. To the west, you can see the main gate, but there is no walkway going in that direction. A large gun emplacement is right in front of you. To the southwest, there used to be ramparts until the rebel airship crashed into them and reduced them to rubble. The only exit is down the stairs into the guard house.

fields.name: Servant's quarters
fields.description: You are in a small, plain building with several bunks and a few tables and chairs. The simple furnishings indicate that this room is used by the Clone Master's servants. There is a door in the south wall, which is sealed tightly. A door to the north leads out to the courtyard.

fields.name: South courtyard
fields.description: You are at the south end of the outer courtyard. To the south is a high stone wall surrounding the inner compound. Over the main gate is a large sign that reads "Good soldiers are reborn." The courtyard extends to the north. To the east and west are high walls of buildings.

fields.name: Inner courtyard
fields.description: You are inside the inner courtyard of the fortress. To the south is the high brick wall of a large building, with no windows. A road goes east toward a palatial building, and west toward the tall building with the black spire on top. To the north is the large gate leading to the outer courtyard.

fields.name: Outside the weapons lab
fields.description: You are on the road in the inner fortress. To the west, the road leads to the inner courtyard. To the east, a palatial building of elaborate stone and metal rises into the sky. To the south is a more industrial looking building with tall, skinny windows. Through the windows, you can see unusual devices which may be weapons.

fields.name: Weapons lab
fields.description: You are in a large stone building filled with various mechanical oddities. It appears to be the Clone Army's weapons research laboratory. There are parts of cannons and crossbows and several broken swords lying about. A large table in the center of the room holds metal gears and tanks, glass vessels, and some vials of brightly colored, bubbling liquids. A door to the north is the only exit.

fields.name: Officers' lounge
fields.description: You are on the ground floor of a large, palatial building with elaborate stonework. This room is the officers' lounge, with several nicely appointed tables and chairs, writing desks under the windows, and couches along the wall. A wide stairway leads up to a balcony, and there is a large room to the south. A door to the east leads to the kitchens.

fields.name: Officer's quarters
fields.description: You are in the officers' quarters. There are small rooms to each side with bunks. You don't spot anything useful in there. The only exit is north.

fields.name: Kitchens
fields.description: You are in a large, hot, and grimy kitchen. The air is thick with the smoke of roasting meat, and pots of stew bubble on the hearth. Servants hurry away as you approach. A door leads west and another door in the south wall appears to be sealed off.

fields.name: Outside the cloning lab
fields.description: You are on the road inside the inner wall of the fortress. To the east is the inner courtyard. To the west, the road continues toward the tall spire of the power station. To the south is a large building.

fields.name: The entrance to the cloning lab
fields.description: You are at the entrance to a large building to the south. Above the double doors is a sign reading "Top Secret - Keep out." A road goes to the north.

fields.name: Cloning lab
fields.description: You are inside a large building with no windows. Metal pipes and machinery line the walls, and there are several work tables with technical documents and experimental equipment. Tanks of green and orange fluid line the walls, with various life forms growing within. There are big double doors to the north and south, and a small door in the east wall.

fields.name: Clone room
fields.description: You are in a large room with double doors to the north. Tubes with bubbling green liquids are being piped in through the walls. Strange humming noises fill the room.  You recognize this room from the rebels' description: The clone room!

fields.name: Outside the power station
fields.description: You are on the road inside the inner walls. To the south is the power station, a towering black building topped with a spire holding a large glass sphere. To the west is a single-story building with bars on the windows. The road goes east toward the inner courtyard.

fields.name: Power station
fields.description: You are inside the power station. The ceiling rises out of sight into the darkness, except for a brilliant blue glow at the top where the lightning collector sphere rests. Cables, gears, and pipes line the walls. In the center of the room is a large machine with a console on it. To the north is the main road, and there is a door in the south wall.

fields.name: Prison
fields.description: You are inside the Clone Master's prison. It is a stark room with a few chairs and desks for the guards. Cell doors, bolted from the outside, lead north, west, and south. A larger door leads east to the outside.

fields.name: South cell
fields.description: You are in a bare cell with an iron door to the north.

fields.name: West cell
fields.description: You are in a stark cell with a door in the east wall.

fields.name: North cell
fields.description: You are in a stark cell with a door in the south wall.

fields.name: Upper Balcony
fields.description: You are on the upper balcony of the large stone building. An ornate railing surrounds it on the north and east, giving a clear view of the battlefield and bay in the distance. A door leads west and fancy wooden double doors with gold trim lead south. A stairway in the middle leads down.

fields.name: Command center
fields.description: You are in a large room with several desks and work stations. Dials and gauges show readings from the instruments in the cloning laboratory and power station. A table in the center holds maps of the area and figurines showing the positions of the armies, abandoned now that the battle is joined. Through the windows, you can see the battle raging in the outer courtyard. A doors leads east.

fields.name: Clone Master's quarters
fields.description: You are in a fabulous living quarters that can only belong to the Clone Master himself. A large painting covers the east wall. A set of double doors lead north to the balcony. Through a curtain you see another room to the south. In the west wall is a small door, which someone has carelessly left ajar.

fields.name: Clone Master's bedroom
fields.description: You are in a fabulous bedroom with a large, luxurious canopy bed. There are several expensive-looking paintings and statues on the walls. An archway in the north wall, lined with velvet drapes, is the only exit.

fields.name: The vault
fields.description: You are inside a dark vault with solid stone walls. The only exit is through a stout metal door to the west.

fields.name: A hallway at the top of the stairs
fields.description: You are in a narrow hallway used by the servants. To the east is a door. A stairway leads down.

fields.name: In an east-west tunnel
fields.description: You are at the east end of one of the narrow tunnels used by the servants. The tunnel leads west, a stairway leads up, and there is a door to the north.

fields.name: An intersection of tunnels
fields.description: You are at an intersection of two narrow tunnels. Tunnels lead north and east from here, and there is a stairway going up to the west.

fields.name: A landing at the top of the stairs
fields.description: You are in a narrow tunnel with a door at the west end and a stairway leading down. Several pipes and cables are attached to the walls and ceiling, disappearing through the wall above the door. You hear the hum of machinery nearby.

fields.name: In a north-south tunnel
fields.description: You are in a narrow tunnel running north and south. To the south you see an intersection. To the north the tunnel extends a long distance. If you have your directions right, it seems like it must pass underneath the inner wall of the fortress.

fields.name: electricity lab
fields.description: You are in a lab with dozens of electrical contraptions lying around. The air smells of ozone. The only exit is north.

fields.name: Pistol
fields.description: You see Nasreen's sidearm, a long, shiny steel pistol with elaborate metalwork on the handle and trigger.

fields.name: crossbow
fields.description: You see Nevil's shiny clockwork crossbow. Its windup mechanism looks like it can load quickly and pack quite a wallop into a bolt.

fields.name: sword
fields.description: You see Norwood's sword. It is a standard-issue military sword with some nice engraving on the hilt.

fields.name: rebel airships
fields.description: Above you float the two rebel airships, massive contraptions of metal cloth, gears, and propellers. Their crews are preparing to drop bombs on the Clone Army.

fields.name: dynamite
fields.description: You see a few sticks of dynamite, tied together in a bundle. The rebel armorer hopes they will be powerful enough to destroy the cloning machines.

fields.name: crack
fields.description: The last airstrike opened a crack in the wall. It's too small to climb through, but you could probably break it open with some explosives.

fields.name: crashed airship
fields.description: The damaged airship crashed against the wall of the fortress. Broken machinery is everywhere, and soldiers are scrambling to salvage what they can.

fields.name: crack
fields.description: There is a crack in the wall of the fortress, made when the airship crashed into it. It's too small to climb through, but you could probably open it wider with enough explosives.

fields.name: hole in the wall
fields.description: You see a hole in the fortress wall to the east, big enough to climb through.

fields.name: hole in the wall
fields.description: You see a hole in the wall to the west, big enough to climb through.

fields.name: hole in the wall
fields.description: You see a hole in the fortress wall to the west, big enough to climb through.

fields.name: hole in the wall
fields.description: You see a hole in the east wall, large enough to climb through.

fields.name: halberd
fields.description: Leaning against the wall is a long halberd made of some kind of shiny black metal. The shaft has elaborate carvings and gilding on it, and it has a worked leather strap for carrying it over your shoulder.

fields.name: helmet
fields.description: You see an odd-looking helmet made of black metal similar to the rebels' armor. It has a ridge running the length of the top, from front to back, and a pair of built-in goggles.

fields.name: desk
fields.description: You see the guard commander's desk. There are papers strewn about and the drawer was left ajar.

fields.name: papers
fields.description: You see some papers sitting on the desk. They mostly look like personnel reports. You spot a memo reminding the troops of the necessity to oil the bearings on the fire cannon.

fields.name: pass key
fields.description: You see a metal card with holes punched in it. In your travels in Knieriem, you have seen this type of card used as a pass key in various mechanical locks.

fields.name: cutlass
fields.description: You see a guard's cutlass. It has a long, shiny blade of standard steel, and some nice metalwork on the hand guard.

fields.name: fire cannon
fields.description: Atop the wall is a large cannon manned by several soldiers. At its base is a large mechanism of gears which allow it to be turned in any direction. With a loud boom, it hurls a flaming projectile out into the battlefield, which explodes among the rebel army.

fields.name: broken fire cannon
fields.description: The cannon's firing mechanism has jammed and it stands here, useless.

fields.name: servant's door
fields.description: You see a plain metal door in the south wall. It is sealed tightly and looks too sturdy to break down.

fields.name: inner gate
fields.description: You see the massive gate leading to the inner complex. It is 15 feet high and made of heavy wood and finely wrought black steel.

fields.name: destroyed inner gate
fields.description: You see the ruins of the inner gate, its finely wrought metal now a twisted hulk. One side hangs lazily from its hinges, and the other side has a hole big enough to drive a Knieriem steam-powered car through.

fields.name: door
fields.description: There is a door in the south wall, with a key card slot in the wall next to it.

fields.name: glass grenade
fields.description: You see a round glass vessel with metal bands around it and a metal lid. It contains a slimy, green liquid which glows eerily. It sits on a pedestal under a glass dome, which has written on it in red ink the words, "Danger! Highly unstable!"

fields.name: rifle
fields.description: You see a large, heavy rifle with several gauges and dials on the outside. There is a set of two glass lenses on the top, used for aiming at a distance. It looks difficult to use, but you think it would pack a wallop, if it works.

fields.name: servant's door
fields.description: You see a plain metal door in the south wall. It is sealed tightly and looks too sturdy to break down.

fields.name: roast boar
fields.description: You see a succulent roast boar cooking on a spit over the fire. The aroma is mouth-watering.

fields.name: water jugs
fields.description: You see three water jugs, tied together.

fields.name: uniforms
fields.description: You see some uniforms of the clone army. There are enough for everyone in your group.

fields.name: console
fields.description: You see a large console with many dials, gauges, and levers on it.

fields.name: bound rebel soldier
fields.description: You see a large rebel soldier, bound in chains. He introduces himself as Natty of Nickleton and says "About time you got here. Get these chains off me and we'll bust some clone heads!"

fields.name: bound dragon
fields.description: You see a large red dragon, bound in several layers of heavy chains.

fields.name: Clonatorium
fields.description: You see a large machine with tanks of green fluid, surrounded by pipes and cables. There are human beings growing inside of it! It is the Clonatorium!

fields.name: destroyed Clonatorium
fields.description: You see the ruins of the Clonatorium. The tanks are smashed and the pipes bent and mangled. It will never produce another clone again!

fields.name: flamethrower
fields.description: You see a large weapon shaped like a gun, with a hose attached to the back leading to a glass tank of red, flammable liquid.

fields.name: painting (secret passage east)
fields.description: You see a large painting on the wall showing the vast skyline of Knieriem City with its magnificent spires and arches. As you touch the frame, it shifts and you realize it is concealing a secret door to the east!

fields.name: painting
fields.description: You see a very, very odd painting in an old frame. You can't quite make out the name, something like "Pickleman?"

fields.name: Buddha statue
fields.description: You see a small jade statue of Buddha. Its beauty is captivating, alluring, distracting.

fields.name: canopy bed
fields.description: You see a large canopy bed surrounded by expensive silk curtains. On the nightstand is a painting of the Clone Master surrounded by four beautiful women who all look exactly alike.

fields.name: gold bars
fields.description: You see a pile of gold bars, welded together. When (of if) you make it home, they will be worth big bucks.

fields.name: diamond
fields.description: You see the biggest diamond you have ever seen in your life here!

fields.name: statue
fields.description: You see a small bronze statue here. It is finely crafted, though of rather cheap materials.

fields.name: dead soldiers
fields.description: You see the charred and mangled bodies of a group of clone soldiers, killed by the blast from the fire cannon.

fields.name: resonant transformer
fields.description: You see the inventor's latest device sitting on a table top. It has wires all around the base, with a tall, slender shaft rising from it and a large metal ring at the top.

fields.text: Nasreen runs up and says, "Wait! We need that to destroy the cloning machines." But it's too late. The fuse is already lit!
The guards inside the inner gate see your uniforms and wave to you. With a loud clanking sound, the huge inner gates roll open.
Once inside the gates, you smash the gears that open the gates. The gates can't be closed again.
The soldiers see that you aren't clones. They attack!
The cannon shoots a great fireball out into the middle of the clone army. It explodes with a boom, sending soldiers flying. A cheer goes up from the rebel army.
The fireball arcs in the air toward the tall, black spire of the power station. It seems to hit an invisible wall and explodes harmlessly over the inner courtyard.
A fireball flies toward the inner gate and impacts it with a resounding crash. Flames explode everywhere, reducing the massive gate to a pile of twisted metal.
As you try to reload the cannon, the loading mechanism jams. Looks like the soldiers weren't keeping up with the required maintenance.

The armies rush toward each other and engage, firing their crossbows and rifles at each other. The rebel airships float toward the walls and begin dropping their round metal bombs. The clone soldiers return fire from a cannon mounted on the fortress wall.

A huge airship rises from beyond the walls of the fortress and sails toward one of the rebel ships. The ships fire on each other. Within minutes they are both badly damaged, crashing toward the earth. The rebel ship lands on the eastern fortress wall, while the clone ship crashes onto the battlefield. The Clone Master and several of his generals disappear in the flames.

The two armies are still fighting. The clone army is defending the main gates, but your commando team should be able to sneak away to the east or west.

The dragon stretches and roars, then smashes its way out the door and flies off through the inner courtyard. You hear shouts and cries of pain from that direction, and you can see guards running everywhere. Whether they're trying to stop the dragon or get out of its way, you can't tell.

You hack at the cloning machinery. The glass tanks shatter with a mighty crash, spilling sticky cloning fluid all over the floor. You chop at the pipes, mangle the valves, and snap the power cables. The Clonatorium is thoroughly destroyed!

The remaining machinery clanks and groans, raising a deafening clatter. Fires break out and grow quickly among the spilled oil from some of the machines. Outside the building, you hear shouts going in all directions.

After the destruction of the clone army, the remaining fire fleets are quickly subdued. The rebels escort you back to Knieriem City and throw a party that lasts three weeks. Then they book your passage on one of the mighty, smoke-belching Knieriem steam ships and send you home.

The inventor turns on his machine, which hums with a sharp buzzing sound. Small lightning bolts begin to appear in the air around the metal ring.

The inventor powers down the machine and says, "This coil generates a high voltage. If you can attach it to the cloning machines, you may be able to damage them."

He continues in his strange accent, "Now, I must return home to my lab. Thank you for creating a distraction so that I might escape." He hurries out the door.

You yank some power cables from the Clonatorium and plug them into the transformer. It emits a mighty crackling sound and soon the lightning bolts at the top grow larger and larger. You stand back and watch in awe as the bolts arc to the pipes and panels of the Clonatorium, burning dark holes in the metal. In moments, the entire Clonatorium is a wreck, and the transformer is melted and deformed.

The Clonatorium is thoroughly destroyed!

The remaining machinery clanks and groans, raising a deafening clatter. Fires break out and grow quickly among the spilled oil from some of the machines. Outside the building, you hear shouts going in all directions.

You light the grenade and hurl it into the mass of machinery. It explodes into a ball of vicious green and purple flames. Cables snap and pipes are torn asunder, releasing oil which bursts into flames. In moments, the Clonatorium and all its cloning tanks are thoroughly destroyed!

The remaining machinery clanks and groans, raising a deafening clatter. Fires rage from the spilled oil. Outside the building, you hear shouts going in all directions.
You light the grenade and throw it at your enemies. It explodes into a ball of vicious green and purple flame. Your foes recoil in horror as the flames scorch them.

fields.name: Nasreen
fields.description: You see the leader of the commando mission, Nasreen of Northampton. She is wearing armor of black metal that looks surprisingly light and comfortable. She carries a heavy pistol which looks to be made from the same material.

fields.name: Nevil
fields.description: You see another rebel soldier, Nevil the Gnasher. He carries one of the rebels' metal clockwork crossbows.

fields.name: Norwood
fields.description: You see a third rebel soldier, Norwood the Nervous. He holds his sword nervously. This appears to be his first commando raid.

fields.name: clone army
fields.description: The Clone Army is here. They are all men, all with identical uniforms, and identical faces, too. There must be hundreds of them. Seeing the same image staring at you from hundreds of different faces is unnerving. They prop up their shields and take aim at you with their strange metal crossbows.

fields.name: rebel army
fields.description: Right behind you is the rebel army. They wear elaborate uniforms of leather and brass. The foot soldiers wear strange, round goggles, while the officers wear metal helmets with a spyglass mounted on them. Their weapons are a combination of swords, pikes, and heavy, clockwork-driven crossbows.

fields.name: Clone Master
fields.description: A small man in fancy metal and leather armor leads the army. He carries a pistol and wears leather-bound goggles. The rebels point him out as the Clone Master himself!

fields.name: clone soldier
fields.description: You see two clone soldiers in standard-issue uniforms. They look exactly alike.

fields.name: clone soldier
fields.description: You see two clone soldiers in standard-issue uniforms. They look exactly alike.

fields.name: clone soldier
fields.description: You see some clone soldiers in standard-issue uniforms. They look exactly alike.

fields.name: clone officer
fields.description: You see an officer of the clone army. He looks just like the soldiers, but for a bit of gray in his hair. He is sitting on a chair with his leg bandaged. He picks up a cutlass and brandishes it at you, while bracing himself on his desk.

fields.name: clone soldier
fields.description: You see a clone soldier.

fields.name: clone soldier
fields.description: You see five clone soldiers.

fields.name: Clone Master
fields.description: You see a small man wearing metal and leather armor, with a pair of leather-bound goggles pushed up onto his forehead. It's the Clone Master! Or maybe one of his clones?

fields.name: general
fields.description: You see three of the Clone Master's top generals. They are standing by the window, looking out at the battlefield. They look just like the soldiers but for fancier uniforms.

fields.name: inventor
fields.description:
You see a man with dark hair and a mustache working on a metal contraption. He is unarmed. When he sees you enter, he puts his hands up and speaks with a distant accent.

"You are not clones," he says. "You must be from Knieriem. The Clone Master kidnapped me from my laboratory in Knieriem City three months ago. He has been forcing me to keep the power plant running. I think I know a way out. There are servants' tunnels all over the compound, which you can use to get around without the guards noticing."

fields.name: guard
fields.description: A clone soldier is here, patrolling the prison and guarding the prisoners.

fields.name: hill giant
fields.description: You see a badly beaten hill giant. Her hair is burned and her skin is badly scarred. In a guttural tongue, she explains that the Clone Master was experimenting on her to see if he could create an army of giants.

fields.name: Natty
fields.description: You see a disheveled soldier in a tattered rebel uniform. He thanks you for freeing him and introduces himself as Natty of Nickleton.

fields.name: red dragon
fields.description: The dragon stands up and shakes its mighty head. It snarls at you and breathes a gout of flame toward the ceiling.

fields.name: clone soldier
fields.description: A large group of soldiers is stationed outside the building, blocking your entrance.

fields.name: Clone Master
fields.description: You see the Clone Master, looking exactly as you remembered him, except with fewer scars. His hair is wet with what smells like cloning fluid and he is just putting on his helmet. He picks up a large device that looks like a gun attached to a hose and a tank. He says, "You ruined my best suit of armor. Now it's time to die, rebel scum!"

fields.name: clone soldier
fields.description: You see several clone soldiers. They are just donning their uniforms. They must be freshly cloned.

fields.name: clone soldier
fields.description: You see a clone soldier running toward the clone lab.

fields.name: panicking soldier
fields.description: You see a disheveled clone soldier running from the rebel army.

fields.name: panicking soldier
fields.description: You see a disheveled clone soldier running from the rebel army.

fields.name: lion
fields.description: You see the Clone Master's pet: A beautiful lion. He has not been declawed.

fields.name: clone gunner
fields.description: You see some clone soldiers manning the big fire cannon.

fields.name: servant
fields.description: You see two of the Clone Master's servants. They are carrying the bodies of dead soldiers through the tunnels.

fields.question: How do I get through the inner gate?
How do I open the door in the servants' quarters and the kitchens?
How do I open the locked doors in the inner courtyard?
There are too many soldiers! How do I get into the clone lab?
How do I destroy the Clonatorium?

fields.answer: There are two ways. Look around the buildings in the outer courtyard for items that might help.
Some doors can only be opened from the other side.
In Knieriem, they use metal punch cards as keys. Try searching the buildings in the outer courtyard.
Try creating a diversion. There are a couple ways to do this, and each one will reduce the number of soldiers.
Or you could try looking for secret doors...
There are several ways to do this. Try looking for some items that you could USE to destroy it.
If you can't find the items, remember that you can ATTACK inanimate objects. But, the longer you take, the more soldiers will show up to try to stop you.
If you find some clone soldier uniforms, the soldiers will open the gate.
Or you could blow up the gate using the fire cannon.
Free the dragon and use the power console to shut down the power. Each of these will distract some of the guards.
USE the glass grenade or the resonant transformer. Those are the fastest ways.
There are at least two ways to accomplish most of the tasks in this adventure. Depending on which you find first, you could have a completely different experience.
Easter egg: Does the inventor and his invention remind you of anyone from Earth history?
The glass grenade is also useful for attacking large groups of enemies (USE GRENADE). But you only get one shot at it.
